questions.question: We got a bang …………………….. seeing the movie star.
questions.description: To get a bang out of something is to be excited about it.

questions.question: The trainer backed ………………………. from the enraged tiger.
questions.description: To back away is to move backward.

questions.question: He never took a ………………………… glance.
questions.description: Backward can be an adverb and an adjective. Backwards can only be an adverb.

questions.question: Her bad spelling kept her …………………….. becoming a secretary.
questions.description: To keep somebody from something is to prevent them from it.

questions.question: Don’t feel ……………………… about breaking the glass.
questions.description: When you feel bad about something you are unhappy about it.

questions.question: I feel ………………………. enough to go to hospital.
questions.description: When a person feels ill, he feels bad.

questions.question: Customs officers examined all ………………………. at the airport.
questions.description: Baggage does not have a plural form.

questions.question: The fishhook was ……………………….. with a worm.
We watched the fight with …………………………….. breath.
…………………………. balance, his accomplishments outweigh his faults.
